Instrument.name: Lunar Prospector Spacecraft Magnetometer - Electron Reflectometer
Instrument.description: The Lunar Prospector Spacecraft Magnetometer and Electron Reflectometer (MAGER) instruments were based on the instruments flown on the Mars Global Surveyor spacecraft. Some changes were made to the Lunar Prospector versions to account for the spinning spacecraft. Also, there was only one magnetometer sensor on Lunar Prospector. The instrumentation consisted of a 3-axis fluxgate magnetometer, a symmetric hemispherical electrostatic analyzer, and their common electronics box. The MAG/ER experiment investigated the origin and nature of lunar crustal magnetic fields and constrain the size of a metallic core. The experiment provided global maps of the lunar crustal magnetic fields and provided estimates of the lunar induced magnetic dipole moment.
